data.title: Where was Hang 'Em High filmed?
data.meta_description: Take a trip back to the Wild West! Discover the filming locations for Hang 'Em High, including scenes filmed at various sites in America. Learn more about how and where to visit them today.

About Hang 'Em High

Jed Cooper's indomitable spirit allows him to triumph over a near-death experience, setting the stage for an unforgettable journey of justice and revenge. Appointed as Deputy U.S. Marshal, Cooper's unwavering quest takes him through treacherous obstacles with a compassionate widow by his side. As this cinematic gem unravels, it delves deep into the profound consequences of Cooper's vengeful mission, shedding light on the perils faced by those who serve the law. After its release in August 1968, the film experienced tremendous success. It achieved a significant milestone in Baltimore alone, earning an impressive opening-day revenue of $5,241. This accomplishment made it the biggest opening in United Artists' history, surpassing even the renowned James Bond films. The film debuted at number five on Variety's weekly survey of top movies, and within just two weeks of screening, it managed to recoup its production expenses. Ultimately, it amassed $6.8 million in the United States and an additional $4 million internationally, resulting in a remarkable worldwide gross of $10.8 million.

Hang 'Em High Locations

The classic western Hang 'Em High, directed by Ted Post and released in 1968, was filmed across multiple regions of the United States. Most of the film came to life in various locations in New Mexico, including parts of Albuquerque, the EspaÃ±ola Valley, and a few other cities on the outskirts of the state. The region boasts a stunning backdrop of snow-capped mountain peaks, open desert spaces, and charming desert towns, creating the perfect atmosphere for a classic Western. The movie also features several locations from Arizona, such as the Superstition Mountains and parts of the Gila National Forest. Notable landmarks include the ancient cliff dwellings at Montezuma Castle National Monument, Sedona, and Oak Creek. Furthermore, several scenes from the film were captured in California, encompassing various areas in Kern County and locations in and around Bakersfield. It is worth noting that the region provided the setting for the movie's climactic sequences. A trip to the filming locations of Hang 'Em High would be worthwhile. From the stunning landscapes of New Mexico to the breathtaking views of Arizona, the film fans will explore the setting where the action happened. In Kern County, California, visitors can explore the ranch where the movie's climactic showdown.

Cooper (Clint Eastwood) is unjustly accused and subjected to lynching by a group of vigilantes. Tension fills the air as the noose tightens around Cooper's neck, creating a sense of impending doom. The camera captures the fear and desperation in Cooper's eyes, emphasizing the injustice and brutality he is about to endure. Nestled in the heart of the Mesilla Valley, Las Cruces, New Mexico, exemplifies the merging of rich history and modern development. From its humble beginnings as a small mining town, Las Cruces has become the second-largest city in New Mexico. The arid climate, stunning mountain views, and bustling downtown define the city, with unique shops and restaurants. Las Cruces is also home to numerous museums, theaters, and festivals offering a glimpse into the vibrant culture. Whether exploring the nearby Organ Mountains or indulging in the city's famous green chile cuisine, there is plenty to do in Las Cruces. Getting to Las Cruces is easy, with several airports within a reasonable distance. The nearest airport is the El Paso International Airport, just a short drive or shuttle ride away. For those driving, the city is easily accessible from the east and west via I-10.

Marshal Dave Bliss (Ben Johnson) saves the almost lifeless Cooper (Clint Eastwood), bringing him to Fort Grant. At that location, the territorial judge, Adam Fenton (played by Pat Hingle), carefully reviews the evidence and ultimately determines that Cooper is innocent. Setting him free, Fenton cautions Cooper against seeking personal vengeance. Instead, Fenton presents an alternative: a position as a marshal. Cooper agrees to this offer, with Fenton emphasizing the importance of capturing the lynchers alive for a fair trial rather than resorting to lethal force. Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios, Inc. Cooper (Clint Eastwood) and Rachel (Inger Stevens) find themselves on a picnic together, where their relationship takes an unexpected turn. It is a pivotal moment of connection and intimacy as they bond and become lovers. The context of the picnic scene carries emotional weight, as it occurs amidst the backdrop of a larger story that revolves around Cooper seeking justice for a wrongful lynching attempt. Few places compare to the charming and vibrant community of Thousand Oaks. Nestled in the Conejo Valley, this city boasts a breathtaking landscape of rolling hills and a mild Mediterranean climate. Beyond its natural beauty, Thousand Oaks is a hub of entertainment and culture, with its iconic Civic Arts Plaza and world-renowned annual Jazz and Art festivals. Families can also take advantage of some of the state's best schools, including California Lutheran University, which sits proudly within the city limits. Hop on a flight and land at the nearby Los Angeles International Airport, Burbank Airport, or Camarillo Airport. If you prefer to travel by car, take the 101 or the 23 freeway to reach your destination.

Thousand Oaks Filming Locations Tour

In conclusion, the iconic classic movie Hang 'Em High took viewers on a wild journey through the western United States. The primary filming locations included New Mexico, Arizona, and California. These locations provided a vast range of scenery, from open deserts to rugged mountains, adding a unique visual experience to the film. Many scenes came to life in Albuquerque, New Mexico, and along the Apache Trail in Arizona. Furthermore, lesser-known, such as the Vasquez Rocks and Mystery Mesa, were incorporated to enhance the visual effects. From the endless landscapes to the intense plot, Hang 'Em High is an unforgettable classic that will continue entertaining viewers.
